citation.article-title: Isolation of a new genus of sulfate-reducing bacteria and description of a new species of this genus, Desulfomicrobium apsheronum gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Desulfomicrobium apsheronum sp. nov.
Desulfomicrobium apsheronum (apsheronum, isolated from stratal waters in the Apsheron peninsula)
The bacteria consist of rod-shaped cells 0.7-0.9 x 1.4-2.9 μm in size with rounded ends, solitary or in pairs.
Motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
Spores are not formed.
Gram-negative cell wall structure. cell walls negatively stained in the gram reaction.
Obligate anaerobes.
Metabolism respiratory, chemoorganoheterotrophic or chemolithoautotrophic.
Sulfate is reduced in media containing lactate, pyruvate, malate, and ethanol, which are oxidized to acetic acid.
Growth is maintained for more than three subcultures in medium containing sulfate in an atmosphere of H2 + CO2 in the absence of organic additives (acetate, yeast extract).
Autotrophic growth is also achieved in medium containing formate and sulfate.
Growth on formate + sulfate was observed in the presence and absence of yeast autolysate.
Electron acceptors include sulfate, sulfite, and thiosulfate, which are reduced to H2S, but elemental sulfur, nitrate and oxygen do not serve as electron acceptors.
Acetate, propionate. butyrate, methanol, isobutanol, isobutanol + acetate, ribose, glucose, fructose, succinate, oxalate, and sodium citrate are not utilized during sulfate reduction.
Pyruvate and fumarate are fermented.
Growth in the presence of reducing agents.
Vitamins and microelements are not essential.
Growth in the presence (up to 8%) and absence of NaCl.
Growth in the temperature range of 4 to 40°C with an optimum at 25-30°C.
Cells contain cytochromes c and b.
Desulfoviridin absent.
The content of GC in the DNA is equivalent to 52 mol. % (chromatographic method)
Type strain, strain 1105.
Stored in the All-Union Culture Collection of Microorganism, Moscow.
Origin: stratal water of oil-bearing deposits.
